comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: City is described at en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C5%81%C3%B3d%C5%BA Street is probably en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Piotrkowska_Street "Piotrkowska Street (Polish: ulica Piotrkowska), the main artery of Łódź, Poland, is one of the longest commercial thoroughfares in Europe, with a length of 4.9 km. It is one of the major tourist attractions of the city.' One of the photos on the Wikipedia page was taken the day after te Germans occupied the city in 1914.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks for your research swanq, and for connecting this photo to the photo on the Wikipedia page.  It could well be the same main street.
